page.title: 15Upton Magna Village Hall
page.content: The village hall was opened at the end of the 1920's.Mr Corbet opened the village hall in Upton Magna.The Corbets were the first landed family in Upton Magna,who owned most of the land around the village. The village hall roof is made out of asbestos,it used to be thatched,but one night in the early 1920's it burnt down,and so it has an asbestos roof because it will not burn. The village hall is used for Cubs and Scouts on Monday,Play school on Tuesday,Women's club on Tuesday night,Brownies on Wednesday,Y.F.C on Wednesday night,and sales and auctions on some Friday nights.Dances,social activities,jumble sales,parties, weddings,and childrens sports,take place occasionaly,as well as an old peoples monthly meeting. About 580 people use the village hall in a week.
